name: Salicylic Acid Acne Healing Dots
about: What it is: The only patented acne patch that combines clean hydrocolloid polymer technology and actives to minimize the look of breakouts overnight...Skin Type: Normal, Dry, Combination, and Oily..Skincare Concerns: Redness, Acne, and Blemishes..Formulation: Mask..Highlighted Ingredients:.- Encapsulated Salicylic Acid: Penetrates pores to target acne blemishes and blackheads..- Retinol (Retinyl Acetate, Vitamin A): Promotes clear-looking skin..- Aloe Vera Leaf Extract: Gently soothes while minimizing the appearance of redness...Ingredient Callouts: This product is vegan, gluten-free, cruelty-free, and comes in recyclable packaging...What Else You Need to Know: Our petroleum-free, medical-grade hydrocolloid contains anti-acne ingredient encapsulated salicylic acid to boost efficacy and reduce the risk of irritation. Retinol promotes clear-looking skin and aloe vera contains soothing properties. Visibly reduce breakouts in 6 hours or less...Clinical Results: In a consumer study:.- 91% of participants said that after using the product, their blemish was less red, less uncomfortable, and significantly less annoying in 6 hours.- 91% of participants said that the product healed the acne that it was applied to.- 95% of participants said the product helped soothe their skin where it was applied...
ingredients: -Salicylic Acid: Penetrates pores to target acne blemishes and blackheads..-Aloe Vera Leaf Extract: Gently soothes while minimizing the appearance of redness..-Vitamin A: Helps promote clear-looking skin. ..Salicylic Acid 0.5%, Glyceryl Hydrogenated Rosinate, Paraffinum Liquidum, Cellulose Gum, Pentaerythrityl Tetra-di-t-butyl Hydroxyhydrocinnamate, Styrene/Isoprene Copolymer, Aloe Barbadensis (Aloe Vera) Leaf Extract, Retinyl Acetate...The list of ingredients is subject to change, please consult the packaging of the product purchased.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-After cleansing, apply a dot, tacky side down, directly on your blemish..-For best results, wear for at least six hours..-For even peskier breakouts, use with Peace Out Acne Serum (sold separately)..-If you're experiencing any areas of excessive dryness, open skin, or went a little heavy handed with peels, chemical exfoliation, or actives, give your skin a little resting time before using Peace Out’s dots or patches.

reviews.review_text: I’ve been using Peace Out’s Original Acne Dots for a few weeks now, and they’re a solid choice for spot treatment if you know what to expect. Each box has two packets with 10 dots each, which is awesome for keeping them clean and ready to use.  These dots are on the thicker side, so I’ve found they work best overnight or on makeup free days. They come in a skin toned beige, so they’re not super obvious but still noticeable if you’re out and about.  What I love most is how well these work on open comedones or popped pimples. They really draw out the gunk and help flatten the area by morning. However, they’re not quite as effective on closed comedones, those deeper, unpopped bumps don’t seem to respond as well.  Overall, Peace Out Original Acne Dots are great for emergency blemish care and work best when used on the right kind of spot.

reviews.review_text: I am providing an honest review. We are only allowed two photos. One is from 11pm and the second is 7am the next morning. You have to keep it on for average 12-48 hours to really see any real change. Realistically, you'll probably remove it when you shower or put on makeup for the day, so you'll to apply a new one to continue the treatment. You'll probably want to use this along with something else. If you only use this, it gets pricey. It is similar to other brands, but this one is tinted beige skin tone, with freckle spots. This one is slightly on the thicker side, one size only, and sticky. A lot of packaging for very little product. I would not go out of my way to purchase this unfortunately. reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: These patches work better than the majority of other pimple patches due to the salicylic acid. Many patches use only hydrocolloid which draws gunk out when a whitehead is present but doesn't exfoliate when a pimple is just forming. Salicylic acid causes cell turnover so these patches work on newly forming zits in addition to zits with a visible white center. I've also had success removing a milia using these patches. One word of caution: the active ingredient in this patch is strong and so they shouldn't be left on for 24 hours like a normal pimple patch. Start with just an hour or two to see how your skin reacts and go up from there. I did notice when patches are larger than the area needing treatment, my skin does get some redness surrounding the zit.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I was very excited when I received the Peace Out acne healing dots. They are my absolute favorite acne patches. Although I find the price is a bit high for the amount you get compared to other brands; I have yet to find another brand that works as well as Peace Out. I prefer to wear them at night (you can cover them with your foundation if you wish to wear them during the day) so I need a dot that won't fall/rub off while I am sleeping. Peace out acne healing dots are the only brand I have found that I never have to worry about falling off. They adhere perfectly to my skin and stay in place. They are also the most fast acting dot I have used. When I have an pimple I just stick on a patch, go to sleep and in the morning the patch has pulled all the dirt and oil out and onto the patch. It quickly diminish the size of the pimple and speeds up the healing time. Depending on the size and aggressiveness of the pimple it sometimes takes two nights with a patch but after that my pimple is gone. Due to the price I sometimes try other brands but I am often disappointed and always go back to Peace Out. These dots are one of my top repurchases at Sephora. I highly recommend; they are easy to use and highly effective. I love them. I received this product for free from Topbox Marketing for testing and review purposes.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Many of us can relate to the struggle of picking at blemishes! For years, I haven't found anything truly effective until I discovered the world of hydrocolloid patches. It was a game-changer!  My patch journey began with the popular CosRx Acne Pimple Master Patch. Being Korean-made, it appealed to my trust in Korean skincare. While these patches did help absorb fluid from already-popped blemishes, their price increased after the pandemic, and they only offered one main ingredient: hydrocolloid. This worked okay for post-pop situations, but I wanted something more for those under-the-skin troublemakers.  That's when I found Peace Out patches! These patches boasted additional ingredients to fight acne and bacteria, making them incredibly effective against those under-the-skin pimples. However, their effectiveness came at a premium price tag.  Knowing my tendency to pick (a work in progress!), I came up with a strategy. I started using Peace Out patches strategically - only on un-popped blemishes. This allowed me to get the most out of their power while managing my budget. The results were amazing – they truly helped those under-the-skin pimples disappear!  To find a more budget-friendly option for everyday use, I discovered LitBear patches, a Chinese brand. While not as powerful as Peace Out, they contain witch hazel for a gentle benefit. I noticed both LitBear and Peace Out patches worked differently than the CosRx brand. Their unique formulas seemed to draw out fluids more effectively, which I believe is due to the added ingredients.  My Patch Arsenal:  Peace Out: My go-to weapon for those stubborn, under-the-skin pimples. LitBear: My daily warrior for more general blemish control. This approach allows me to target different types of blemishes effectively, without breaking the bank!  I received this product for free from Topbox Marketing for testing and review purposes.

As someone who deals with pesky breakouts, finding something that actually works is a total life-changer. Why I’m in Love: These dots are seriously amazing! They truly work wonders, speeding up the healing process of my acne overnight. The powerhouse combo of salicylic acid, retinol, and aloe vera is perfect for zapping blemishes, promoting clear skin, and soothing any redness. Plus, they’re vegan, gluten-free, cruelty-free, and come in recyclable packaging – all things that align with my values.  Results: After sticking one of these babies on a stubborn pimple before bed, I woke up to a noticeable reduction in redness and size. In just six hours, my acne was less red, less painful, and WAY less annoying. My skin felt soothed and calm, which is a HUGE plus!  What Could Be Better: The packaging, though super cute, has a few issues. The dots sometimes stick to the inside, making them tricky to peel off. And the bright orange color doesn’t exactly blend with my skin tone, so wearing one during the day can be a bit awkward.  Despite these minor hiccups, I’m absolutely hooked on these patches! They’ve become a must-have in my skincare routine for their effectiveness. I really hope the brand tweaks the packaging to make it more user-friendly. Until then, I’m totally willing to overlook the slight inconvenience for the sake of clear, happy skin.  Would I buy them again? I’m on the fence because of the packaging hassle, but their undeniable effectiveness keeps me coming back. I received this product for free from Topbox Marketing for testing and review purposes.

reviews.review_title: Works Well Functionally, Poor Design & Packaging
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I received this product for free from Topbox Marketing for testing and review purposes.The 2 stars are for its functionality. These dots work well functionally but I was quite disappointed by their poor design and wasteful packaging.  These dots adhere well to the skin and are great for reducing acne inflammation and absorbing discharge. I like how it provides protection from external bacteria while absorbing all its excess oil. I found this spot patch heals my acne spots a lot faster than other brands, possibly attributed to it containing salicylic acid. I used these dots on my stubborn and inflamed acne spots, changing them twice a day, once in the morning and another after showering in the evening, or more frequently when there was a lot of oil extract on the patch.  These dots were designed to have a thick circular shape and comes in only one size. They have a yellowish color with brown specks that looks awful against my fair skin tone. Both its color and thickness make it standout like a sore thumb and cannot be covered up. I'm fine with wearing these when I'm at home all day, but definitely not when I'm going out. The worst thing for me was that these dots adhered so well to my skin that they were very painful to remove, and pulled out my fine hair in the process, unless the dot was fully and entirely saturated with discharge.  This package of 20 dots came in a nicely packaged box with 2 ziploc pouches, each of which contained a sheet of 10 dots. There was so much empty space in the box that it could have fit at least another 5 pouches, not to mention that the box itself is unnecessary as the pouch already provides sufficient branding and protection for the dots. Likewise, splitting a box of 20 dots into 2 pouches is unnecessary as all 20 could have fit nicely into a single pouch. There's also a design issue with the packaging as my sheet of dots was stuck to the inside of the pouch and when I finally pulled it out, several dots were adhered inside and wasted.

reviews.review_text: The acne healing dots are amazing! They made my bigger zits smaller and truly helped me get rid of them. I have been wanting to try peace out and honestly it was worth it. The salicylic acid not only shrinks the size of the pimple but helps you get rid of them overnight.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Peace Out Acne Healing Dots are a lifesaver for anyone dealing with breakouts. These small patches pack a powerful punch with ingredients like salicylic acid and vitamin A to target pimples and promote healing. I've found them incredibly effective at reducing inflammation and redness overnight, making my breakouts noticeably smaller by morning. The convenience of simply placing a dot over the affected area makes them easy to add into my skincare routine. Overall, Peace Out Acne Healing Dots are a must-have for anyone looking for a quick and effective solution to breakouts.

reviews.review_title: No longer a holy grail product

Such a shame- the past 6 packages I’ve bought have all been that way so I can no longer recommend these. It also seems the dots themselves aren’t as effective at helping with pimples as they once were.

These cost way too much for more than half the sheet to be entirely unusable. You can see in the photo what I mean. Learned my lesson. Won’t buy again and do not recommend.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I recently tried out peace out pimple patches, hoping for a solution to those pesky breakouts. While they where yellow witch I really did not like they where ok not the best imo but they did help a little 🫤  One of the first things I noticed about these patches was their distinct yellow color, which wasn’t exactly appealing. Additionally, their effectiveness left something to be desired. While they did provide some coverage and protection for my blemishes, they didn’t seem to accelerate the healing process or reduce redness as much as I had hoped.  On the positive side, the patches adhered well to my skin and stayed in place throughout the night. They were also relatively easy to apply and remove without causing irritation. However, their lackluster performance in actually diminishing the appearance of pimples was disappointing.  Overall, [Brand Name] pimple patches were okay but didn’t quite live up to the hype. If you’re looking for a quick fix for breakouts, these might provide some temporary relief, but don’t expect miracles.
